Content: [Caption, Close The next presidential election is more than a year away, but the field of Republican primary candidates is already the biggest bunch in 100 years. And candidates are still trickling into the poolWisconsin Gov. Scott Walker and Ohio Gov. John Kasich both declared candidacy this week. At this point, its anyones guess who could take the race. But a new poll of likely Republican voters, conducted by Bostons Suffolk University and USA Today, sheds some light on who may come out ahead. Researchers polled 1,000 American adults by phone between July 9 and July 12, asking them for their preference in the no6-candidate field. They report a margin of error of +/- 3 percent. Based on that sampling, only two of sixteen candidates are top picks among double-digit blocs of likely Republican voters, while seven are favorites of less than two percent. Donald Trump, the current leader of the pack, has surprised many pundits, who just weeks ago forecast his candidacy would crash and burn. See the full rankings above.]
Author: [Dylan Baddour, Houston Chronicle]
Title: [Donald Trump earns surprising frontrunner status in Suffolk/USA Today poll of favored GOP candidates]
